column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////I was with a friend
column2: and we started off with a single order of bruschetta. It was fucking delicious... fresh tomatoes
column4: basil on tasty toasted bread. Yes
column5: I was biased because it was the first real Chicago thing I'd eaten since arriving the night before
column6: but the freshness of it is undeniable. Sadly
column7: it did take up more room than I anticipated. So when we got to the Maltani Chicago Classic pizza
